meanings.definition: To cause to be or become; make
meanings.sent1: Adding sugar renders the drink sweet.
meanings.sent2: The artist renders the scene beautifully in her painting.
meanings.sent3: The chef renders the vegetables into a delicious soup.
meanings.sent4: Her smile renders the room brighter.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting over the horizon renders the sky a beautiful orange hue.

meanings.sent1: The company renders excellent customer service.
meanings.sent2: She renders assistance to those in need.
meanings.sent3: The kind gesture renders comfort to the grieving family.
meanings.sent4: His generosity renders him a beloved figure in the community.
meanings.sent5: The charity renders aid to those affected by the disaster.

meanings.definition: To represent or depict in art or music
meanings.sent1: The painter renders the landscape with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: The musician renders the melody with passion.
meanings.sent3: The sculptor renders the figure with intricate details.
meanings.sent4: Her voice renders the song unforgettable.
meanings.sent5: The artist renders emotion through every brushstroke.

meanings.sent1: The chef renders the fat to make a flavorful sauce.
meanings.sent2: He renders the bacon fat for cooking.
meanings.sent3: The process of rendering fat requires patience.
meanings.sent4: The heat slowly renders the fat into liquid.
meanings.sent5: The recipe calls for rendering the fat before adding other ingredients.

meanings.definition: To submit or present for consideration
meanings.sent1: She renders her report to the supervisor for review.
meanings.sent2: The student renders his project for grading.
meanings.sent3: He renders his proposal for approval.
meanings.sent4: The team renders their findings for discussion.
meanings.sent5: The artist renders her sketches for feedback.
